Chapel_Hill.Sonja Haynes Stone Center for Black Cult:
The Sonja Haynes Stone Center for Black Culture and History (originally the Black Cultural Center) was founded on July 1, 1988 at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.


== Foundation and renaming ==
The center’s goal, according to its first director, Margie Crowell, was to advance black literary and artistic endeavors while trying to understand the cultural diversity on campus.
